DOC.brief_summary: The investigator examine effect vitamin D supplementation glucose homeostasis metabolic marker healthy normal weight overweight young subject healthy normal-weight overweight elderly subject live Beirut , Lebanon .
DOC.detailed_description: A low serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D ( 25 ( OH ) D ) concentration show correlate higher fast blood glucose ( FBG ) insulin level metabolic abnormality like dyslipidemia . Previous study suggest vitamin D supplementation able improve insulin sensitivity metabolic marker . The aim study investigate effect vitamin D supplementation glucose homeostasis metabolic marker healthy normal weight overweight young subject healthy normal-weight overweight elderly subject live Beirut , Lebanon . Participants ( n= 180 ; 93 men 87 woman ) deficient vitamin D recruit Saint Charles Hospital , Beirut , Lebanon . Four group recruit : normal-weight adult ( n=30 , age ≤ 65 year BMI < 25 kg/m² ) , overweight adult ( n=30 , age ≤ 65 year BMI ≥ 25 kg/m² ) , normal-weight elderly ( n=60 , age ≥ 65 year BMI < 25 kg/m² ) overweight elderly ( n=60 , age ≥ 65 year BMI ≥ 25 kg/m² ) . Participants receive supplement 10,000 IU cholecalciferol take three time per week period 6 month . Glucose homeostasis metabolic marker measure start treatment , 3 month 6 month .
DOC.criteria: Participants medical history congestive heart failure , acute heart insufficiency renal failure include Participants medical history congestive heart failure , acute heart insufficiency renal failure exclude
